resources.string: Development of own speech and speech comprehension
Skills related to taking care of themselves

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__1__
string-array.item: Opens their eyes wide, wakes up or flinches when hearing a sound.
Looks for the source of a sound.
Gets scared or cries when hearing a loud and sudden sound.
Reacts to a voice by moving arms and legs actively or on the opposite becomes still and silent.
Keeps their eyes on an adult’s face.
Stares at a toy in front of them.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__2__
string-array.item: Looks the mother in the eyes when she feeds them.
Follows an object’s movements with their eyes.
Imitates an adult’s facial expressions.
Recognizes their mother’s voice.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__3__
string-array.item: Recognizes adults they already know.
Vocalizes their emotions.
Looks at a toy put in their hands.
Looks at their fingers and moves them.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__4__
string-array.item: Turns their head at the sound (left or right).
Reacts to their name, turns around.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__5__
string-array.item: Looks at their hands, puts them together symmetrically.
Listens attentively to sounds.
Stops crying when their hear music or their mother singing.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__6__
string-array.item: Reacts to sounds within no less than a three meter radius.
Watches moving objects attentively, examines toys.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__7__
string-array.item: Defines the source of a sound below and from the side.
Has binocular vision.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__8__
string-array.item: Notices small objects.
Listens to the adult’s talk.
Becomes still when they hear an unfamiliar sound.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__9__
string-array.item: Defines the source of a sound from any direction. Reacts to sounds within no less than a 4.5 meter radius.
Examines the toys they hold in their hands, hits them against each other.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__10__
string-array.item: Actively tries to imitate sounds and syllable groups, reacts to changes in the speaker’s tone.
Continuously stares at the speaker’s face.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__11__
string-array.item: Starts to understand simple commands ("give", "put").
Knows and reacts to some household sounds — sound of the car, dog’s bark, phone ring.
When asked, can show at least one part of a doll’s body (face).
Is interested in their reflection in the mirror.

string-array.name: hearing_and_vision__12__
string-array.item: Hearing is close to that of an adult: reacts to various sources of sound, defines their location.
Reacts to sounds within 6 meters.
Looks at the pictures in books.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__1__
string-array.item: Is able to briefly lift their head by the end of the first month.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__2__
string-array.item: When lying on the back, lifts their head and briefly holds it.
When lying on the back, jerks their legs.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__3__
string-array.item: When lying on stomach, leans on arms and lifts their head at right angle and hold it for more than a minute.
When sitting or being put vertically holds their head straight.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__4__
string-array.item: When lying on stomach, lifts their head and shoulders.
When lying on stomach, can turn over using your help.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__5__
string-array.item: When lying on the back, lifts their arms and legs.
Can roll over from one side to another and flip from back to front.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__6__
string-array.item: Sits leaning on something.
Holds their mother’s fingers tight when she lifts them to sit up.
When lying on stomach, leans on one arm and reaches for an object they want with the other.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__7__
string-array.item: Flips from back to front.
When lying on the back, pull their legs close and plays with them.
Sits unsteadily, leaning forward.
Can stand for a short time when held by the arms.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__8__
string-array.item: Sits steadily. Can sit without support leaning on the arms.
Crawls backwards like a seal.
Is trying to stand on their own holding onto something. Stands holding onto something.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__9__
string-array.item: Crawls forward and about themselves on their stomach.
Sits steadily.
Gets up on their own holding onto something. Makes several steps if they are being supported.
Lifts one leg.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__10__
string-array.item: Crawls back and forth on all fours.
Stands almost without support.
Can sit on the floor when standing.
Stands up holding onto something.
Makes walking movements.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__11__
string-array.item: Crawls on all fourth in all directions.
Walks sideways holding onto something.
Makes 1 or 2 steps with your help.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__12__
string-array.item: Sits steadily on their own.
Can make several steps holding the mother’s hand.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__12__18
string-array.item: Walks on their own.
Kicks a ball.
Runs steadily, doesn’t fall down, dodges corners and stops suddenly.
Climbs and sits on a chair.
Climbs structures on the playground.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__18__24
string-array.item: Climbs up and down a ladder or stairs, putting one foot after the other on each step.
Climbs a slide on their own and rides it.
Keeps their balance and leg coordination in active games (running, climbing, jumping)

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__24__30
string-array.item: Jumps down a step with both legs.
Plays ball with other children, can throw a ball and catch it at least every second time.
Can stand on one leg for several seconds without support.
When standing, can jump over small objects.

string-array.name: gross_motor_skills__30__36
string-array.item: Pedals a tricycle.
Can stand on one leg steadily without support.
Can jump over obstacles when running.
Can tumble forward.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__1__
string-array.item: Has a good grabbing reflex.
The fists are clenched.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__2__
string-array.item: Reaches for a toy but can’t grab it.
The palms are half-open.
Shakes a rattle when you give it to them.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__3__
string-array.item: Reaches their toy and hits it but still can’t grab it.
Examines their fingers and moves them.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__4__
string-array.item: Plays with their hands.
Puts their hands together symmetrically in front of them.
Grabs an object when they reach it. Tries to put it in their mouth.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__5__
string-array.item: Reaches for a moving object and tries to grab it.
Picks a toy with one hand, then with the other and examines it.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__6__
string-array.item: Holds a bottle.
Shifts a toy from one hand to the other. Shakes it, feels it with their hands, hits it on the table.
Reaches for a second toy and grabs it, but drops the first one.
Grabs items with an index finger and a thumb.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__7__
string-array.item: Can play with two toys at the same time.
Holds a cookie.
Can hold a toy only with their fingers (not the palm).

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__8__
string-array.item: Can pull off a sock.
Plays patty-cake.
Points at an object with their finger.
Puts one toy away when they want to take another.
Learns to pick up items with their thumb, index and middle finger (cortical opposition)

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__9__
string-array.item: Throws toys intentionally.
Picks up toys or blocks from a box.
Eats with their fingers.
Starts to learn pincer grip (with a thumb and an index finger)

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__10__
string-array.item: Hits objects against each other.
Rolls a ball on the floor.
Grabs a spoon by its long part.
Picks up a cup with both hands.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__11__
string-array.item: Points at an object of interest with their finger.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__12__
string-array.item: Claps their hands.
Can hold a pencil, scribbles with it.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__12__18
string-array.item: Prefers their leading hand.
Scribbles with a piece of chalk or a pencil.
Flips pages of a children’s book (one by one).
Can screw and unscrew bottle and jar caps.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__18__24
string-array.item: Scribbles in circles.
Builds towers out of five and more blocks.
Holds a piece of chalk with several fingers like an adult.

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__24__30
string-array.item: Tries to cut things with small scissors.
Builds towers out of eight and more blocks.
Draws vertical and horizontal lines.
Builds block structures (simple houses, bridges).

string-array.name: fine_motor_skills__30__36
string-array.item: Draws a full circle, two lines crossing.
Pieces together a jigsaw puzzle.

string-array.name: social_development__1__
string-array.item: Makes it clear that they are hungry, in pain or unhappy by crying.
Calms down when being picked up, talked to kindly or breastfed.

string-array.name: social_development__2__
string-array.item: Smiles back at you.

string-array.name: social_development__3__
string-array.item: Actively moves arms and legs, laughs when being kindly spoken to.
Recognizes adults they already know.
Watches moving people.

string-array.name: social_development__4__
string-array.item: Examines themselves in the mirror.
Turns around when they hear their name.
Cries when left alone.
Laughs out loudly when amused by an adult.
Is happy when being played with.

string-array.name: social_development__5__
string-array.item: Recognizes adults they know and reaches out for them.
Laughs when parents make faces.
Stops crying when spoken to.
Turns to the speaker.

string-array.name: social_development__6__
string-array.item: Is alerted by strangers.
Cries when their toys are takes away.
Reaches out when they want to be picked up.

string-array.name: social_development__7__
string-array.item: Shows their parents their love by clinging to them.
Can tell the difference between kind and angry tone and facial expressions.
Plays hide-and-seek with a handkerchief.

string-array.name: social_development__8__
string-array.item: Cries when mother or father leave.
Watches adults.

string-array.name: social_development__9__
string-array.item: Cries or gets angry when being told off.
Gets their first preferences.
Laughs when they see someone close to them.

string-array.name: social_development__10__
string-array.item: Understand being said goodbye to.
Hugs their mother.
Starts to understand being praised.

string-array.name: social_development__11__
string-array.item: Imitates their parents’ actions (bye-bye, no-no).
Stops doing what they have been told off for.

string-array.name: social_development__12__
string-array.item: Keeps doing things that make their mother laugh.
Kisses their parents.
Likes watching themselves in the mirror, smiles at their reflection, plays with it.

string-array.name: social_development__12__18
string-array.item: Asks for help.
Starts helping around the house.
Plays with other children.

string-array.name: social_development__18__24
string-array.item: Sometimes says no when being pestered.
Usually behaves correctly when reproved.
Shows affection towards other children.
Puts their favorite toy to sleep with them.
Feels empathy towards other children, tries to help and comfort them.

string-array.name: social_development__24__30
string-array.item: Expresses their complaints in words.
Says hi.
Says "look" when they want to draw your attention.
Plays active games with other children.
Offers help.

string-array.name: social_development__30__36
string-array.item: Apologizes when they do something bad.
Usually follows instructions when playing with other children and waits for their turn.

string-array.name: speech_development__1__
string-array.item: Vocalizes feeling discomfort by crying.
Makes sounds like "ah, eh, ooh" by the end of the first month.

string-array.name: speech_development__1_5__
string-array.item: Babbles.

string-array.name: speech_development__2__
string-array.item: Makes more spontaneous sounds.
"Cooes" when being spoken to.

string-array.name: speech_development__3__
string-array.item: Can make three different sounds.
Gives out different types of cries, like showing hunger, pain or being tired.

string-array.name: speech_development__4__
string-array.item: Cooes and squeaks trying to draw attention.
Is happy when they make sounds.
Laughs loudly when being spoken to.

string-array.name: speech_development__5__
string-array.item: Talks to themselves clearly separating syllables.

string-array.name: speech_development__6__
string-array.item: Cooes, babbles, makes happy sounds.

string-array.name: speech_development__7__
string-array.item: Babbles syllables like "la", "wa", "ma", "ba", "na".
Tries to draw attention with particular sounds.

string-array.name: speech_development__8__
string-array.item: Repeats syllables "ma-ma", "pa-pa", "ta-ta".
Imitates various sounds.

string-array.name: speech_development__9__
string-array.item: Can pronounce up to eight different syllables (unintelligibly).

string-array.name: speech_development__10__
string-array.item: Babbling gets more varied.
Can say "mama" and "papa".
Repeats sounds after adults.
Reacts to their name and "give me".

string-array.name: speech_development__11__
string-array.item: Says the first meaningful word.
Understands the notion of "you can’t do that".

string-array.name: speech_development__12__
string-array.item: Says two meaningful words (in the "child speak").
When being told "bring me a toy" goes to look for it, find it and brings it.

string-array.name: speech_development__12__18
string-array.item: Can say at least two words apart from "mama" and "papa".
Can answer "what does the kitty/doggy say?"
Uses at least five words for different objects.
Can show a mouth, a nose, arms and legs when asked to.
Knows prepositions "on" and "with".
Understands two-stage instructions like "go to your room and bring me…"
Understands at least three prepositions of place, like "in", "on", "under", "at", "next to".

string-array.name: speech_development__18__24
string-array.item: Knows several familiar objects in a picture book.
Uses no less than ten words.
Answers "yes" or "no" correctly when asked simple questions.
Says "bad" or "donwanna" if they don’t like an object.
Understands "up" and "down", "one" (gives only one item when asked to), "all".
Can show one color when you name it.

string-array.name: speech_development__24__30
string-array.item: Asks "more", "one more".
Says "don’t", "donwanna" etc.
Uses at least one of the following: "I", "you", "he", "she", "it", "me".
Can speak in two, three-word sentences or more.
Can describe what is going on in a picture.
Says "my" or "mine" about their things.
Uses past tense like "The car fell down".
Can say their name.
Shows or names the bigger of two objects.
Understands no less than 6 words describing location, like "in", "over", "on", "under", "at", "next to", "above", "below", "higher", "lower".
Can tell other children’s gender correctly (boy or girl).

string-array.name: speech_development__30__36
string-array.item: Asks questions starting with "what", "where", "why", "when", "how".
Uses nouns in different cases (other than nominative).
Uses plural and future tense.
Uses words "good" and "bad".
Can answer questions like "What are cookies for?"
Knows their age.
Uses words like "quick" and "quickly", "slow" and "slowly".
Talks about what is going to happen.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__3__
string-array.item: Drinks from a spoon and opens their mouth when they see it.
Can eat from a spoon.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__4__5
string-array.item: Holds a bottle with both hands when sucking on it.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__6__
string-array.item: Can take off their hat.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__7__
string-array.item: Holds a cookie in their hand and bites on it.
Can put the bottle to their mouth on their own.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__8__
string-array.item: Drinks from a cup.
Can eat small bits of food on their own.
Can pull off a sock.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__9__
string-array.item: Eats with their fingers.
When getting dressed, puts their arms into the sleeves on their own.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__10__
string-array.item: Picks up a cup with both hands.
Grabs a spoon by its long part.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__11__
string-array.item: Tries to drink from a cup on their own.
Eats a dry toast on their own.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__12__
string-array.item: Drinks from a cup on their own.
Tries to eat with a spoon on their own.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__12__18
string-array.item: Takes off shoes and socks.
Uses a small bucket or other container to carry things.
Turns the handle and pulls the door when opening it.
Wipes spilled liquid with a cloth or a sponge.
Gives an empty plate to the mother or the father.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__18__24
string-array.item: Can take off an unbuttoned shirt on their own.
Can unzip things.
Washes and wipes their hands.
Eats with a spoon and a fork almost without spilling.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__24__30
string-array.item: Can wash their face and brush their teeth on their own.
Can pour a liquid into a cup without spilling.

string-array.name: self_dependence_skills__30__36
string-array.item: Can put on a shirt on their own.
Can bathe almost without assistance.
Puts on shoes correctly (left shoe — left foot, right shoe — right foot).
